meanings.definition: Exclude (someone) from a society or group.
meanings.sent1: The group was ostracising the new student because they were different.
meanings.sent2: The community was ostracising those who did not follow their rules.
meanings.sent3: It seemed like the playground was ostracising the lonely swing set.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to be ostracising the sun from shining through.
meanings.sent5: The act of ostracising can make someone feel very isolated and alone.

meanings.definition: To banish or expel from a community or group.
meanings.sent1: The village decided to ostracise the troublemaker to maintain peace.
meanings.sent2: The council was considering ostracising the member who broke the rules.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was always getting itself ostracised from the other pets.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to be ostracised from the rest of the forest, standing alone.
meanings.sent5: Being ostracised from a group can sometimes lead to self-reflection and growth.
